statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: St. Francis, NY 69, St. Francis, Pa. 57
article.headline: St. Francis, NY 69, St. Francis, Pa. 57
article.linkText: St. Francis, NY 69, St. Francis, Pa. 57
article.story: NEW YORK -- Akeem Bennett scored 18 points and had 10 assists to help St. Francis (N.Y.) defeat St. Francis (Pa.) 69-57 on Thursday night. The Terriers (4-8, 2-1 Northeast Conference) scored 23 points off of 20 Red Flashes turnovers, including seven give-aways by Umar Shannon, to snap a three-game losing streak. The Red Flashes, who have a turnover margin of negative-3.5 had just 10 assists, compared to 17 by the Terriers. Bennett was 11 of 12 from the free throw line and the Terriers shot 85.7 percent from the line in the second half (18 of 21). The Terriers shot 50 percent from the field in the first half (12 of 24) and outscored the Red Flashes (4-10, 2-1) 35-26 in the second half. Kayode Ayeni scored 15 points and Ricky Cadell added 11 for the Terriers. Shannon finished with 18 points for the Red Flashes, who have lost five of their last six.
